DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Other Surgery Second Course Type Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Codes for the type of surgery performed on tissue or organs other than the primary site and regional lymph nodes as part of the second course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Other Surgery Second Course
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgery performed on tissue or organs other than the primary site and regional lymph nodes as part of the second course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment:  See 1998 ROADS Manual for codes - Surgery of Other Regional Site(s) or Distant Lymph Node(s)]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subsq RX 2nd--Surg Oth Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Central registries currently collecting this data item should follow the 1998 ROADS Manual coding instructions. The codes are the same as those for Surgery of Other Regional Site(s), Distant Site(s) or Distant Lymph Node(s), 1998 ROADS Manual, p. 194. See also First Course Calc Method [1500].
